about.description: Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses that cause illness ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome. 2019-nCoV is a new strain that has not been previously identified in humans. You can protect yourself by washing your hands frequently, avoiding touching your face, and avoiding close contact (1 meter or 3 feet) distances with people who are unwell

symptoms.title: What are the Symptoms ?
symptoms.description: COVID-19 symptoms range from mild to severe. It takes 2-14 days after exposure for symptoms to develop. Symptoms may include :

contagion.title: How does coronavirus spread ?
contagion.description: Health experts are still learning the details. Currently, it's thought to spread :

details.name: Via Respiratory droplets produced when an infected person Cough or Sneeze.
Between people who are in close contact with another (within about 6 feet).

imageId.description: Air Transmission by Cough or Sneeze
Direct contact with pets and others
Direct contact with others or friends
Contaminated objects such as food or gadget

prevention.title: How can I protect myself from Covid-19 ?
prevention.description: If you are travelling overseas (to China or other Country Places) Follow the CDC's guidance :

details.title: Cover Face When Coughing
details.sub_title: Cover your mouth/nose with a tissue or sleeve when coughing and sneezing.

details.title: Wear Face Mask
details.sub_title: Always use your mask when wou want travel suddenly and when buying food.

details.title: Wash Your Hand Frequently
details.sub_title: Wash hands often with soap and water. If not available, use hand sanitizer

details.title: Avoid Animal Contact
details.sub_title: Always avoid direct contact with both pets and animal in the wild.

details.title: Avoid Market and Crowd
details.sub_title: Always avoid crowds and crowded places to avoid direct transmission.

details.title: Seek Medical Care
details.sub_title: CAlways medical checking to check whether we are healthy or we have been infected.
